title.narrative: Provision of life-saving winterization assistance along with fire prevention System for the most vulnerable people in NW Syria

description.narrative:
**Mercy-USA for Aid and Development in this project will support internally displaced persons (IDPs) and host community in Maaret Tamsrin and Jandairis, sub-districts with winterization support in the form of restricted value-based E-vouchers for winterization. **Mercy-USA for Aid and Development in this project will support the most vulnerable people in Maaret Tamsrin and Jandairis, sub-districts in two components: 1- CCCM Component: Establish fire units (points) and fire warden committees and trainings for fire prevention and response in the targeted camps in Maaret Tamsrin sub-district. 40 fire units/points will be established and 40 fire warden committees will be established and trained in the targeted camps (Attached) to maintain safety of IDPs and feeling secure without fear of fire hazards might hits in any moment especially during winter season.
Each committee will receive two days Fire warden Training. Each training will have 15-20 participants to maintain social distancing, so total of 20 training will be conducted
2-SNFI Component: Winterization support by using the modality of restricted value-based E-vouchers for winterization. for IDPs living in informal tented settlements in Harbanush camps cluster -Ma'arrat Tamasrin Sub-district – Idleb governorate in addition to IDPs and host communities in Jandairis sub-district. The same camps list (attached) for CCCM activities will be targeted with SNFI activities while the other location is Jandairies city (Off camp) will be targeted only with SNFI activites
Total number of beneficiaries who will be targeted 8295HH - 41475 individuals (Men 8295- Women 9125- Boys 11198- Girls 12857) as blanket distribution in the targeted IDP sites to all beneficiaries while using selection criteria in Jandairis sub-district to choose the most vulnerable people including IDPs and host communities.
Mercy-USA will target each household with total value of 150 USD will be loaded into the E-vouchers divide to three months (50 USD -50 USD -50 USD) throughout the winter months (November 2021, December 2021 and January 2022). Beneficiary can redeem their vouchers in the contracted markets/shops with the preferable fuel for them (Diesel, Olive-pit, Wood, …etc)
**Accountability to Affected population (AAP) will be given high priority in this project by communications and sharing information with beneficiaries during all project phases, as well as using complaints and feedback mechanism which is accessible to all beneficiaries especially the most vulnerable such as persons with disabilities, the elderly, women and girls, thus taking corrective actions based on need. **HLP documents will be given high attention, so all HLP documents for all selected IDPs site to establish fire points should be available to be cleared. ** Furthermore, MEAL plan will be for all project stages such as verification of vulnerability assessment, distribution/redemption monitoring, PDM, Training, construction of fire points with using different MEAL tools. **Reporting will be on timely basis according to the priority, ex., narrative report will be interim and final, while other reports will be on a weekly basis.
